data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To take backward steps you must take 10 steps forward. To take left step you must take 9 steps left. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and take 4 steps to return to the starting point. This is another way of saying take 4 steps away from the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 6 steps for the first 6 steps and there are 4 steps for the final 4 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot make the same back-to-the-starting point again. To return to your original starting point from the same position, you must return to the original starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around takes five steps. Typically you only look back in one direction when you are turned around. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left. Turn right. Turn around. Turn around. Turn left. Turn right. Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Take 7 back to start. Yes. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If one takes 8 steps it will take 8 steps. If one takes 9 this will take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps for the first 8 steps. Then you will be in the starting position. The answer: Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Face forward is the axis that orients you. Take 1 step left and you revert to your starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Step 1: Take 2 steps. Step 2: Take 7 steps. Step 3: Take 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps forward, take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward, take 1 step backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

It is usually impossible to reverse directions by facing forward. The steps to turn and face forward are different than to move backward. Reversing will always return the direction you are facing once you have changed its direction. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps forward and 6 steps left. Take 4 steps backward and 3 steps forward. The total is 9 + 10 = 25 steps. The answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you follow the instructions, you should always always face forward. If you are facing left, and do 4 steps left, you are facing back. If you are facing right, and do 3 steps forward, you are facing front. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

There are three sections in the directions. As you go forward, you have three sections to go backwards and forwards. If you look back, you have three sections to go forward and there is no other section. When you look back, you have three sections to go back straight, one section to go right, and one section to go left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn opposite right into left. Right turns around into left. Eight steps equals 8 steps. So, there is no right turning here. So, the answer is No.

You don’ t go back to the starting point by taking 6 steps back after you take 9 steps in one direction. So, the answer is No.

Turn around is done at the beginning. Return is the same way of turning around. So, the answer is yes.

When you take 7 steps, you can return to the starting point. When you first turn around the direction is up. So, the answer is no.

You start out by walking back. If you turned right, you need to take 7 steps. If you took 1 step, you need to walk back. So, the answer is No.

Turning right and taking 1 step leads back to the previous one. No, you take 4 steps before you can turn left. So, the answer is no.

The instruction does not return to the starting point. There are no instructions for how many Steps to retrace. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You are on the 3rd step if you want to turn, and are unable to go back to the start. The 7th step gives you one extra step to get back to the start. If you turn around the 2nd half of the 2nd step reverts the same, taking 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A sequence of 3 steps should always be facing forward and can include forward, left, right, backward, and forward. This sequence includes 7 steps forward, 2 steps right, 5 steps backward, 4 steps forward, 8 steps left, 2 steps right, and 6 steps forward. An alternate sequence would be to take 8 steps left and to always face the camera forward. So, the answer is no.

Facing forward, you can take a forward step and continue with the instructions to take 4 steps forward, then 4 steps backward and finally take 6 steps left. So, the answer is yes.

The first point you'll come to if you repeat the process is always facing forward. So, the answer is no.

You turn right then take 5 steps up for the back and turn right again. So, the answer is No.

After taking 2 steps backward, you have to take 3 steps backward in order to get back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

Face forward is always the direction of travel. Moving backwards leaves 2 paths. One goes forward and one goes backwards. Walking backwards leaves more room to go forward and is considered forward. So, the answer is No.

When an individual steps 6 steps forward, they are able to take 6 steps forward until they are face-down again. When they take 4 steps forward they are able to take 4 steps forward until they are face-down again. To take 9 steps backward, they are able to take 9 steps backward. They are back in the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Therefore, the answer is No.
